intro: Racosperma scalenum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has slender, often hairy leaves that are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming in dense clusters, and it produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. Racosperma scalenum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
